Romanian Government puts together first aid package for the economy:  "“We increased the ceiling by RON 5 billion (EUR 1.04 bln), we are committed to increasing it by another RON 5 billion, if necessary, and we can reach RON 15 billion. We guarantee loans for investments and working capital, for which the interest is 100% subsidized. The guarantee covers 90% of the loan value, for loans up to RON 1 million, and 80% of those over RON 1 million,” the prime minister said. He added that the Government also decided to reimburse VAT of up to RON 9 billion (EUR 1.87 bln) to allow companies to benefit from the working capital needed to operate."    14bn RON to USD on 19th March is 3099171108.48 USD    https://web.archive.org/web/20200812161901/https://www.romania-insider.com/coronavirus-romania-government-economic-measures  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812161909/https://adz.ro/inland/artikel-inland/artikel/corona-krise-regierung-schnuert-erstes-hilfspaket-fuer-die-wirtschaft  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812161914/https://www.x-rates.com/historical/?from=RON&amount=14000000000&date=2020-03-19

A Government Emergency Ordinance (GEO 30/2020) has been published, outlining social protection measures during the state of emergency due to COVID-19. The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 come into force on 21 March 2020.  'The Labor Code provides that employers can decide unilaterally to suspend individual employment agreements of their employees and place the employees in technical unemployment. The employer is required to ensure from its own funds the payment of a minimum allowance of 75% of the employee’s base salary. However, if the employers meet one of the following criteria, during the state of emergency, the technical unemployment allowance can be supported by the Unemployment Insurance Budget up to the limit of 75% of the average gross salary provided for under the law for the social insurance budget for 2020'.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200502180616/https://home.kpmg/ro/en/home/insights/2020/03/social-protection-measures-during-the-state-of-emergency.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812125709/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

MILITARY ORDINANCE no. 2 of March 21, 2020 bans gatherings of more than 3 persons who do not live together (takes effect March 22; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426195101/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-2-din-21-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

Starting on March 22nd, the national government requires the following of local governments: 1. Local government authorities shall be required to identify and keep records of persons over the age of 65, without supporters or other form of assistance, and to provide support to them in order to minimize their exposure outside their homes.  (2) The records are updated and reported weekly to the county / municipality center of Bucharest for coordination and management of the intervention.  (3) The local, county and Bucharest committees for emergency situations identify ways of support for the persons provided in par. (1).  https://web.archive.org/web/20201119163555/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-2-din-21-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

MILITARY ORDINANCE no. 2 sets out exceptions, but calls for staying at home in other cases. However, only between 2200-0600 (night time), these are mandatory. Therefore coded as 1G (since vast majority of movement is not at night time); Takes effect March 23; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426195101/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-2-din-21-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

1. Symptomatic people with a history of international travel;   2. Symptomatic close contacts of confirmed cases;   3. Symptomatic healthcare personnel;   4. Cases of pneumonia without other aetiology, from all age categories and all hospitals;   5. Cases of Severe Acute Respiratory Illness (SARI) without other aetiology, from all age categories and all hospitals;   6. Symptomatic institutionalized people;   7. All patients due to undergo a transplant procedure (asymptomatic), and all hematopoietic stem cell donors before donation.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200608103555/https://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/1574-algoritm-testare-internare-externare-23-03-2020/file

Individuals are still allowed to go to their work place, there is no general closing: "The movement of all persons outside the home / household is prohibited, with the following exceptions : a) travel in professional interest, including between home / household and the place of professional activity and back. (...) The measure shall be applied from March 25, 2020, at 12.00."  (https://web.archive.org/web/20200428033936/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-3-din-24-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19)     Here is the English version: https://web.archive.org/web/20200428033712/https://www.mai.gov.ro/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ordinance-3-EN-1.pdf

Military ordinance No. 4 prohibits movement of persons outside the house / household, lists multiple exceptions (takes effect March 25); https://web.archive.org/web/20200426200618/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-3-din-24-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

Romania completely bans people over the age of 65 from leaving their homes except between 1100-1300 beginning on March 25th. During the two hours around noon, leaving the home if you are over 65 is only allowed for the following things:  a) travel to provide goods that cover the basic needs of persons and pets / pets;  b) travel for medical assistance that cannot be postponed or made remotely;  c) moving for justified reasons, such as caring for / accompanying a minor, assisting other elderly, sick or disabled people, or in case of death of a family member;  d) short trips, close to the home / household, related to the individual physical activity of persons (excluding any collective physical activities), as well as for the needs of pets / pets.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104193130/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-3-din-24-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

"Measures for social protection and income support introduced by the Romanian government’s Government Emergency Ordinance no. 30/2020 (GEO 30/2020) entered into force on 21 March 2020.1  The measures are focused on supporting individuals and businesses, under certain conditions, experiencing a reduction in their income due to the restrictions imposed by the government in Romania to help prevent the spread of the coronavirus and COVID-19 in the country.  In this GMS Flash Alert, we provide a high-level summary of the key measures introduced."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528145707/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/03/flash-alert-2020-123.html

A military ordinance published by the Romanian authorities on 29th March capped the tariffs for electricity and thermal energy, natural gas, water supply, sanitation and fuels.    Article 8 of this ordinance states 'During the state of emergency period, the prices for electric energy and heating, natural gas, water supply, sanitation and fuel cannot be increased above the level at the issuance date of the present military ordinance; these can only be decreased according to demand and offer.'   The measure came into force on the date of publishing (29th March).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200502183003/https://www.osac.gov/Country/Romania/Content/Detail/Report/81c1698c-36ab-4bc8-826a-1852cf0f015d    https://web.archive.org/web/20200502183050/https://www.mai.gov.ro/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/ordinance-4-2020-EN.pdf

Previous restrictions further specified and food store owners are directed to reserve 1100-1300 primarily for elderly shoppers to protect them from potential infection.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201121101256/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-4-din-29-03-2020

Couldn't find an official announcement regarding extending school closure, but referenced and implied in the following two article:    https://web.archive.org/web/20200426220349/https://www.rferl.org/a/covid-19-russian-railways-suspends-routes-over-coronavirus/30538705.html    "The country has been under a state of emergency since March 16, and President Klaus Iohannis announced his intention on April 6 to extend it by one month, while the government decided to postpone local elections that should have been held in early summer."    And     https://web.archive.org/web/20200426220912/https://www.esu-online.org/?news=romanian-higher-education-system-during-the-covid-19-outbreak    " April 24, 2020    As all education institutions have suspended their face-to-face activities for over one month now, ANOSR is conducting a study that aims to face the challenges of online teaching and learning processes within HEIs."

"Romanian kindergardens, schools and universities will remain closed until the end of the current school year in June to avoid the risk of further spreading the new coronavirus, and will reopen for the new academic year in September, President Klaus Iohannis said on Monday.  Eight- and twelve-grade students - who are facing graduating exams - will be the exception between June 2-12, Iohannis said, while maintaining strict social distancing rules. For the remaining students, classes will continue online, he said."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201202133140if_/https://uk.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-romania/romanian-president-says-schools-to-stay-closed-for-current-academic-year-idUSL2N2CF09A

1. Symptomatic persons, including medical staff according to the case definition;   2. Symptomatic close contacts of confirmed cases;   3. Asymptomatic patients before the transplant procedure and donors of hematopoietic organs, tissues and stem cells before donation; patients with transplants of hematopoietic organs, tissues and stem cells undergoing immunosuppressive therapy, before each hospitalization during the post-transplant monitoring period - 2 tests at 24-hour intervals;   4. Asymptomatic patients with immunosuppression in the context of the disease or drug-induced hospitalization - 2 tests at 24-hour intervals;   5. Asymptomatic cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy and / or radiotherapy - twice a month;   6. Asymptomatic cancer patients before surgery or invasive interventions;   7. Symptomatic haemodialysis patients;   8. Asymptomatic haemodialysis patients contacts with a confirmed case, 2 tests at 6-7 days interval between them; during this period they will be dialyzed in separate sessions from the rest of the patients;   9. Symptomatic institutionalized individuals;   10. Asymptomatic pregnant women in quarantine/home isolation or close contact with a confirmed case;   11. Staff of residential centres/long-term care facilities – twice a month;   12. Asymptomatic healthcare personnel who have been in direct contact with a confirmed case, in the 6th or 7th day since the last contact.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200608103644/https://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/1697-definitii-de-caz-si-algoritm-de-testare-pentru-covid-19-actualizare-28-04-2020-1/file

Previous restrictions of elderly being allowed outside for only two hours a day (1100-1300) are replaced by a 7-hour window, split into mornings and evenings (07.00-11.00 and 19.00-22.00). Shopkeepers are again asked to reserve these hours for elderly customers.  As this constitutes a very significant loosening of restrictions, 2G seems like the closest fit. Measure starts taking effect on April 28.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210124190950/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-10-din-27-04-2020

"Starting Monday, 11 May 2020, all working people will also be able to enter public transport in Romania. The mandatory conditions for all passengers are: compliance with the limit of seats, wearing a protective mask, and sanitary gloves. Passengers must also carry the up-to-date service cards or a certificate issued by their employer."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200813093451/https://www.themayor.eu/en/elderly-in-iasi-with-specially-dedicated-public-transport
Recoded from 1G as state of emergency only ends at the end of the day and restrictions were therefore loosened starting May 16.

With the repeal of the state of emergency on May 15, the restrictions became recommendations on May 16 (the following date), and "the Romanian government recommends all people to avoid crowded areas, to respect social distancing, and to wash their hands often."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812124013/https://www.themayor.eu/en/whats-scheduled-to-reopen-today-in-romania https://web.archive.org/web/20210124192133/https://www.romania-insider.com/state-alert-romania-restrictions

With the repeal of the state of emergency and replacement with a "state of alert," the restrictions on elderly leaving the home end. However, the government continues to recommend caution and moreover asks local governments to continue to supply and assist the elderly (see previous notes) at home. This is further reinforced by a line in the later renewal of the order on June 16 on LTCF, which states that "Residential social service providers shall organize their program according to the existing epidemiological context at local level and in compliance with the rules in force on labor legislation. The activity at the level of these services will be organized and carried out in compliance with the rules for preventing the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 virus established by the competent authorities."     Therefore 1G maintained.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210124192133/https://www.romania-insider.com/state-alert-romania-restrictions  https://web.archive.org/web/20210124192818/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-476-din-16-iunie-2020

"The Romanian authorities are preparing for a scenario in which schools in the country will remain closed in September when the new school year will start. Courses could thus move online, and the local education system should be digitized by then, education minister Monica Anisie said in TV interviews over the weekend.  About 250,000 of the 3 million students enrolled in primary and secondary education in Romania don't have access to technology and can't participate in online courses, the education minister said at Digi24.  The Romanian authorities closed all schools and kindergartens in the country on March 11 to stop the spreading of the COVID-19 epidemic. The decision was enforced before the state of emergency was decreed in the country, on March 16.  On April 27, president Klaus Iohannis announced that schools would remain closed in Romania until the end of the school year."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528142947/https://www.romania-insider.com/covid-19-romania-schools-online-september

Timisoara-based OncoGen, the Romanian institute working on a vaccine against COVID-19, announced on Tuesday, May 26, a partnership with the state-owned Cantacuzino Institute in Bucharest to continue developing the vaccine.    The two institutes have won a RON 3.5 million (EUR 720,000) grant from the Ministry of Education and Research to continue their work.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618131843/https://www.romania-insider.com/romania-covid-19-vaccine-oncogen-cantacuzino-may-2020

Romania will reopen outdoor cafes and restaurants and allow international road and rail travel from June 1.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608102012/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-romania/romania-to-further-ease-lockdown-restrictions-from-june-1-idUSKBN23423F

Romanians will be able to travel between cities without restrictions and outdoor events with up to 500 people will be allowed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608102012/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-romania/romania-to-further-ease-lockdown-restrictions-from-june-1-idUSKBN23423F

"Romania will reopen outdoor cafes and restaurants and allow international road and rail travel from June 1, after a two-month lockdown to contain the new coronavirus outbreak, President Klaus Iohannis said on Thursday. From Monday, outdoor cafes will open with social distancing guidelines and a maximum of four people per table. Romanians will be able to travel between cities without restrictions and outdoor events with up to 500 people will be allowed."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608102012/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-romania/romania-to-further-ease-lockdown-restrictions-from-june-1-idUSKBN23423F

Romanians will be able to travel between cities without restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608102012/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-romania/romania-to-further-ease-lockdown-restrictions-from-june-1-idUSKBN23423F

"Romanian kindergardens, schools and universities will remain closed until the end of the current school year in June to avoid the risk of further spreading the new coronavirus, and will reopen for the new academic year in September, President Klaus Iohannis said on Monday.    Eight- and twelve-grade students - who are facing graduating exams - will be the exception between June 2-12, Iohannis said, while maintaining strict social distancing rules. For the remaining students, classes will continue online, he said."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201202133140if_/https://uk.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-romania/romanian-president-says-schools-to-stay-closed-for-current-academic-year-idUSL2N2CF09A

Romania reopens private schools after June 15th. At the same time, private kindergartens and schools can reopen.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200628124245/https://www.romania-insider.com/ro-reopens-malls-private-schools-june-9-2020

The Romanian Government’s decision no. 476 of June 16 extended the state of alert in Romania by 30 days starting June 17.       The state of alert establishes the following:   - Mandatory wearing of “protection masks” in closed public spaces, stores, public transportation, and at the workplace;  - Resumption of routine health care by appointment and opening of dental offices;  - Opening of hotels, small commercial centers, groceries, cleaners, opticians, stores with direct access to the outside, shopping malls, fitness clubs and outdoor swimming pools;  - Opening of parks (but not playgrounds);  - Private indoor events or no more than 20 people and outdoor events of no more than 50 people.  - The Government of Romania defined “close contact” with COVID-19 infected individuals to facilitate epidemiological investigations. The purpose of defining close contact to identify individuals designated for 14-day self-isolation following close contact with a COVID-19 confirmed infection. During the period of self-isolation, “close contact” individuals will be tested at the beginning and end of the two week period. The epidemiological investigation should not lead to the supervised isolation of other individuals not meeting “close contact” criteria. This includes:   Persons living in the same household as a confirmed COVID-19 patient.  Persons with direct physical contact with confirmed patients.  Persons with unprotected direct contact (i.e. coughing)  Persons in the same room (i.e. students) with a confirmed patient for a minimum of 15 minutes at a distance less than 2 meters.  Medical personnel providing direct care to confirmed patients without proper protective equipment.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200717141723/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Press statements by Prime Minister Ludovic Orban:    Dear Romanians, I felt it is my obligation to make today this statement. Today we registered the largest single-day COVID-19 caseload - 555 Romanians who were declared positive after being diagnosed. Over the last four weeks, we registered an increase in the number of cases from week to week.    Unlike other countries, in Romania, the Government I am leading, had an approach of the gradual relaxation measures, with restrictions lifting phases, relaxation measures phases, once with opening the activities that have been under restriction in various phases, following increased interaction between people, we witnessed an increase in the number of cases from week to week.  I conclude by conveying a message to every Romanian: The virus does not forgive anyone, nor does it forgive those who do not believe in the existence of the virus. If someone overlooks the rules, neglects and exposes himself to illness, when he becomes ill he not only endangers himself, he also endangers his loved ones, family members, relatives, colleagues, and friends.    When you get sick you risk getting your loved ones sick as you may transmit the virus to those you are most often in close contact with. If you don't care about your health and you don't believe in this virus or you think this virus is not dangerous, please care about your brother, your mother, your father, your child, your friends, your colleagues. Only together, in solidarity and respecting simple rules, established by specialists, those who know very well how to fight against this virus, only together can we bring things back to normal and fight the epidemic effectively. I am confident that every Romanian will understand this watershed moment and will understand that success in the fight against the epidemic will solely depend on responsible and correct behaviour towards fellow citizens. Thank you!    Link: http://archive.vn/S8uM1

Travellers planning to stay in Romania for 3 days or less are exempt from quarantine, as long as they provide evidence of a negative COVID-19 test, taken within 48 hours before entering the country."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201019133449/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/romania/entry-requirements    "Are U.S. citizens permitted to enter? The Government of Romania also implemented non-European Economic Area (EEA) travel requirements reflecting the Council of the European Union’s (EU’s) June 30th recommendations, which prohibit non-essential EU travel for U.S. residents. The Ministry of Education and Research announced on 22nd of October that 2401 education units are listed to work in red scenario (Scenario 3), involving the participation only in online activities. 4891 education units are listed in Scenario 2, meaning partial return (by rotation) in compliance with all rules of protection and 10364 in Scenario 1 (daily participation in compliance with all health protection rules).  According to the Order of the Minister of Education and Research and the Minister of Health 5487/1494/01.09.2020, one of the three operating scenarios is the cumulative incidence rate, respectively the total number of new cases in the last 14 days compared to 1000 inhabitants.  Links: https://archive.fo/EUjeg and https://archive.fo/qi24y

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons. Also, GEO 30/2020 refers to the measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons. According to the Order of the Minister of Education and Research and the Minister of Health 5487/1494/01.09.2020, one of the three operating scenarios is the cumulative incidence rate, respectively the total number of new cases in the last 14 days compared to 1000 inhabitants.  Links: and https://archive.fo/qi24y

Starting with 20th of October, the Bucharest City Committee for Emergency Situations announced that all activities carried out indoors in restaurants, coffee-shops, cinemas, theaters and gambling halls will be closed for at least 14 days, as disease rate of the city was over 3.  Also, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection recommended on 10th of March measures to make labor relations more flexible (establishing individualized work programs, temporary modification of the workplace at the employee’s domicile, carrying out the activity through telework).  Link: https://archive.fo/mfaPX  and https://archive.fo/YIB63

The Secretary of State, Raed Arafat, announced on 28th of October that the mask is mandatory in open spaces and closure of cinemas for 368 localities, where the rate of 3 per thousand has been exceeded. Also, starting with 20th of October, the Bucharest City Committee for Emergency Situations announced that all activities carried out indoors in restaurants, coffee-shops, cinemas, theaters and gambling halls will be closed for at least 14 days, as disease rate of the city was over 3.    Link: https://archive.fo/wip/h8Sae and  https://archive.fo/mfaPX

According to the Government’s order 856/14.10.2020, public meetings, rallies, and demonstrations with no more than 100 participants are allowed in compliance with all rules of protection.  Link: https://archive.fo/NUj4k
During the alert state, the protective mask shall be worn in any enclosed public space, public transport and at work, according to Order MS-MAI 874/81/2020.  Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp
Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp
There are no traffic restrictions between localities except for quarantined areas.  Link: https://archive.fo/9KkOQ

On 26th of October, The National Committee for Emergency Situations published Decision no.50 regarding the approval of the list of countries/areas of epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on persons arriving in Romania from them. Also, there are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions).    Link: https://archive.fo/QHwSB and  https://archive.fo/9KkOQ

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers.  According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21.

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases.  Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT  and  https://archive.fo/Vi0vG

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR  have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

"According to the ministerial order 5972/8.11.20, starting on 9.11.20, the teaching activities that require the physical presence of preschoolers and students in preschool, primary, secondary, high school and post-secondary education units are suspended for a period of 30 days. Source: https://archive.fo/7GMr0

Restaurant are required to close at 10 PM nationwide. Restaurant and hotels are subject to periodic ongoing health inspection. Only six people are allowed at one table in restaurants.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201106191444/https://ge.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-on-georgia/ and https://archive.fo/kYCaw
Sports and cultural events are limited to 200 people.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201106191444/https://ge.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-on-georgia/  and https://archive.fo/kYCaw
Social events such as weddings and funerals are limited to 10 guests.  Link: https://archive.fo/kYCaw
The Government of Georgia announced that between 10 PM and 5 AM, public and private transportation is not permitted.  Link: https://archive.fo/kYCaw

The Government of Georgia imposed movement restrictions in major cities between 10 PM and 5 AM. During the restricted time, public and private transportation (including walking) is not permitted, unless it is for an essential need.  Link: https://archive.fo/kYCaw

There are no restrictions on intercity or interstate travel, but effective November 9, the Government of Georgia imposed movement restrictions in major cities between the hours of 10 PM and 5 AM.  Link: https://archive.fo/kYCaw

With a few exceptions, Georgia remains closed to foreign travelers. The entry ban for foreign citizens applies to air, land, and sea borders, including foreign citizens who are legal residents of Georgia, or have been living and working in Georgia, or own property or business.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201106191444/https://ge.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-on-georgia/ and https://archive.fo/kYCaw

Multiple documents were published to prevent spread of Coronavirus through “stopcov.ge”, the official Georgian government’s website: “Recommendations on Personal Hygiene”, “Simple recommendations to protect yourself from COVID-19”, “Rules for Self-Isolation” and “Special Guidance for Risk Groups”.   Links: https://archive.fo/Lq3cv  and https://archive.fo/wip/WpeX6

Face masks must be worn in all enclosed public spaces, including taxis and public transportation. Violators of face musk rules are subject to a 20 GEL (about 6 USD) fine. According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

The Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities. Also, the Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance).  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/Bv8vi , https://archive.fo/cUlEp and https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf.

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://archive.fo/1JWbz

On 20th of November, The National Committee for Emergency Situations published Decision no.55 regarding the approval of the list of countries/areas of epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on persons arriving in Romania from them. Also, there are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions).    Link: https://archive.fo/9KkOQ and https://archive.fo/lIjB1

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers.  According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, “Datelazi.ro” (Updated data) project was released pro-bon by Code for Romania in partnership with the Government of Romania through the Authority for the Digitalization of Romania, containing data and information provided by the Government of Romania.   Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/X428Q

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

The Prime Minister Ludovic Orban announced on 23rd of November the allocation of 1.27 billion euros (1.5 billion dollars), amounts from European funds for equipping hospitals in Bucharest, to increase the capacity to respond to the health crisis caused by COVID-19.  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/OFifq

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was). According to the ministerial order 5972/8.11.20, the teaching activities that require the physical presence of preschoolers and students in preschool, primary, secondary, high school and post-secondary education units are suspended for a period of 30 days. Link: https://archive.fo/wip/Bv8vi , https://archive.fo/cUlEp and https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/T7Aib

On 20th of November, The National Committee for Emergency Situations published Decision no.55 regarding the approval of the list of countries/areas of epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on persons arriving in Romania from them. Also, there are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions).  According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020 of The National Committee for Emergency Situations, the list of countries of high epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on the persons arriving in Romania from them was approved.  Link: https://archive.fo/9KkOQ, https://archive.fo/lIjB1, https://archive.fo/pUara and https://archive.fo/s1GX6

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers.  According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, “Datelazi.ro” (Updated data) project was released pro-bon by Code for Romania in partnership with the Government of Romania through the Authority for the Digitalization of Romania, containing data and information provided by the Government of Romania.   Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/X428Q

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the ministerial order 5972/8.11.20, the teaching activities that require the physical presence of preschoolers and students in preschool, primary, secondary, high school and post-secondary education units are suspended for a period of 30 days. The teaching activities will be carried out online, according to the Framework Methodology on conducting teaching activities through technology and the Internet, as well as for the processing of personal data, approved by order of the Ministry of Education and Research 5545/2020.  Links: https://archive.fo/7GMr0

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, fairs, mixed, flying and flea markets will be forbidden. Also, for the economic operators having activities in closed and/or open spaces, (public or private) to organize their activity only between 05:00 and 21:00. According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020, it is proposed to resume the activity of agri-food markets organized in closed spaces. According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, the meetings on public holidays, public and/or private parties in closed and/or open spaces are prohibited. According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours. The Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.20) of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). The Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp,  https://archive.fo/T7Aib, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/un88p

According to the Decisions 52/5.11 and 58/10.12.20 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Additionally, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/wip/Z2SNH

On 20th of November, The National Committee for Emergency Situations published Decision no.55 regarding the approval of the list of countries/areas of epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on persons arriving in Romania from them. Also, there are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions).  According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020 of The National Committee for Emergency Situations, the list of countries of high epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on the persons arriving in Romania from them was approved.  Link: https://archive.fo/pUara and https://archive.fo/s1GX6

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers.  According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, “Datelazi.ro” (Updated data) project was released pro-bon by Code for Romania in partnership with the Government of Romania through the Authority for the Digitalization of Romania, containing data and information provided by the Government of Romania.   Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/X428Q

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was). The Government approved the Vaccination Strategy against SARA-CoV-2 in Romania. The document establishes the vision, principles, and mode of action for the administration in Romania of COVID-19 vaccines authorized by the European Medicines Agency. Also, the chairman of the National Coordinating Committee for Vaccination Activities against COVID-19 announced that the National Vaccine Storage Center is ready to receive vaccines after the European Medicines Agency issues the conditional marketing authorization. There are three stages of vaccination: first for health care workers, second -for the population at risk, for essential staff and the last stage – for the general population. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

The Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.20) of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). The Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp,  https://archive.fo/T7Aib, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/un88p

According to the Decisions 52/5.11 and 58/10.12.20 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Additionally, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/wip/Z2SNH

On 20th of November, The National Committee for Emergency Situations published Decision no.55 regarding the approval of the list of countries/areas of epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on persons arriving in Romania from them. Also, there are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions).  According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020 of The National Committee for Emergency Situations, the list of countries of high epidemiological risk for which the quarantine measure is instituted on the persons arriving in Romania from them was approved.  Link: https://archive.fo/pUara and https://archive.fo/s1GX6

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers.  According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, “Datelazi.ro” (Updated data) project was released pro-bon by Code for Romania in partnership with the Government of Romania through the Authority for the Digitalization of Romania, containing data and information provided by the Government of Romania.   Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/X428Q

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf

The Government approved the Vaccination Strategy against SARA-CoV-2 in Romania. The document establishes the vision, principles, and mode of action for the administration in Romania of COVID-19 vaccines authorized by the European Medicines Agency. Also, the chairman of the National Coordinating Committee for Vaccination Activities against COVID-19 announced that the National Vaccine Storage Center is ready to receive vaccines after the European Medicines Agency issues the conditional marketing authorization. There are three stages of vaccination: first for health care workers, second -for the population at risk, for essential staff and the last stage – for the general population.  Link: https://archive.fo/KYZQL and https://archive.fo/wip/C61Wh

According to the ministerial order 6122/7.12.20, the teaching activities that require the physical presence of preschoolers and students in preschool, primary, secondary, high school and post-secondary education units are suspended for the period 9th of December – 23rd of December 2020. Until 11th of January, schoolers have winter holiday.  Links: https://archive.fo/2wVGz  and https://archive.fo/wip/c51A8

According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020, it is proposed to resume the activity of agri-food markets organized in closed spaces. The document establishes the vision, principles, and mode of action for the administration in Romania of COVID-19 vaccines authorized by the European Medicines Agency. According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

The Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.20) of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). The Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp,  https://archive.fo/T7Aib, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/un88p

According to the Decisions 52/5.11 and 58/10.12.20 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Additionally, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf, https://archive.fo/wip/Z2SNH and https://archive.fo/cz2hH

There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions), but PCR COVID-19 tests are not required. The National Institute of Public Health published the lists of states with high epidemiological risk.  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/QkpvU  and https://archive.fo/cz2hH

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.  On 30th of December, the Government released Emergency Ordinance no. 224, which includes the support measures to ensure the continuity of the activity of economic operators in the tourism sector, accommodation structures, food structures and travel agencies. These can receive grants, in the amount of 20% from the loss of turnover or turnover in 2020 comparing with 2019 (up to 800 000 euro/enterprise).  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/wip/2xyN6

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. It was released the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19.  Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/O0MTX#selection-697.0-697.76

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf

Second stage of the vaccination campaign started on 15th of January and is aimed at people over 65 age, people with chronic diseases (regardless of age) and key staff working in key areas. The coordinator of the National Committee for the Planning of COVID-19 Vaccination in Romania, announced how the appointments of people over 65 years of age and those with chronic diseases can be made. (Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines are used).  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/IzHsa and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

According to the Decisions 52/5.11 and 58/10.12.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, on 15th of January, the second stage of the vaccination campaign started, aiming people over 65 age and people with chronic diseases.     Link:https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf, https://archive.fo/wip/IzHsa and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

According to the ministerial order 3090/8.01.2021, teaching activities that require the physical presence in preschool, primary, secondary, high school and post-secondary education units are suspended for the period 11th-29th of January 2021. Between 30th of January and 7th of February, schoolchildren and preschoolers have inter-semester vacation.  Links: https://archive.fo/wip/dYf7v, https://archive.fo/r0SkT and https://archive.fo/REcKf

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, fairs, mixed, flying and flea markets will be forbidden. For the economic operators having activities in closed and/or open spaces, (public or private) to organize their activity only between 05:00 and 21:00. According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020, it is proposed to resume the activity of agri-food markets organized in closed spaces. Outdoor cafes and clubs are closed between 11 PM and 6 AM. According to the decision no.6/04.02.2021 of National Committee for Emergency Situations, passenger coming from the countries with high epidemiological risk provided in article 1, have the obligation to present the certificate of a negative PCR test, performed at most 72 hours before the arrival.  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/YGSPs, https://archive.fo/jnaGT  and https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/liste-zone-afectate-covid-19/2250-lista-state-cu-risc-epidemiologic-ridicat-4-02-2021/file

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. It was released the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19.  Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/O0MTX#selection-697.0-697.76

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was). Second stage of the vaccination campaign started on 15th of January and is aimed at people over 65 aged, people with chronic diseases (regardless of age) and key staff working in key areas. The coordinator of the National Committee for the Planning of COVID-19 Vaccination in Romania, announced how the appointments of people over 65 years of age and those with chronic diseases can be made. According to the Decisions 52/5.11 and 58/10.12.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance).
