According to the ministerial order no.3.235/93/04.02.2021, depending on the incidence rate by localities, the activity of the educational units will be organized, starting with 8th of February, in three scenarios: a) Physical presence for all categories, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days in the locality is less or equal to 1/1000 people; b) physical presence for preschool, primary, 8th, 12th and 13th classes, and online presence for the other classes, for a incidence less or equal with 3/1000; c) Online presence for all categories, except preschool and primary units, if incidence is higher than 3/1000. On 12 February, The National Committee for Emergency Situations decided to grant aid to the Republic of Moldova, consisting of 1.5 million surgical masks and 100,000 overalls, FFP3 masks and disposable gloves.     "The Republic of Moldova will receive in the coming days from Romania a free humanitarian aid worth over 2 million euros, consisting of 100,000 overalls, 100,000 FFP-3 masks, 5 million surgical masks, 100,000 gloves. We thank him To the Romanian Government for support, Romania being the first EU country to react immediately to our request for help in the fight against the pandemic", wrote Maia Sandu on her Facebook page.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220204616/https://www.news.ro/social/romania-trimite-republica-moldova-1-5-milioane-masti-chirurgicale-cate-100-000-combinezoane-mastii-ffp3-manusi-unica-folosinta-cnsu-decis-completarea-stocurilor-strategice-aceste-cantitati-materiale-1922404512002021021719973239    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220205231/https://www.digi24.ro/stiri/externe/moldova/romania-va-trimite-republicii-moldova-combinezoane-masti-si-manusi-de-2-milioane-de-euro-mesajul-transmis-de-maia-sandu-1449959?__grsc=cookieIsUndef0&__grts=53795145&__grua=27936219d1c505f9fd46829814111577&__grrn=1

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released. According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was). Second stage of the vaccination campaign started on 15th of January and is aimed at people over 65 aged, people with chronic diseases (regardless of age) and key staff working in key areas. The coordinator of the National Committee for the Planning of COVID-19 Vaccination in Romania, announced how the appointments of people over 65 years of age and those with chronic diseases can be made. (Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines are used).  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/IzHsa and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

According to the Decision 35/10.02.2021, the alert status on the Romanian territory is extended. It is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, on 15th of January, the second stage of the vaccination campaign started, aiming people over 65 age and people with chronic diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/4mnCH and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

Romania began to reopen schools on 8 February, three months after the Government closed schools throughout the country to limit the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.    There are 3 scenarios for reopening schools based on the epidemiological situation in each locality:    The green scenario, which applies to towns with low incidence rates of COVID-19, allows all children to return to school.    The yellow scenario, which applies to cities with moderate incidence rates, only kindergarten children and primary school (I-IV grades) pupils return to school, plus those in the eighth and twelfth grades, who have to prepare for the national exams.    The red scenario, which applies in localities with incidence rates of over 3 per 1,000 inhabitants (over a 14-day period), only kindergarten and primary school children return to school.    Students who can’t return to school, either due to the yellow or red scenarios, will continue online courses, which have been going on for most of the first semester.    Currently, the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is over 3 per 1,000 occupants in Timis and Maramures counties, therefore, these counties are in the red scenario.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211716/https://www.romaniajournal.ro/society-people/education/physical-classes-in-schools-resumed-as-of-february-8/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211543/https://www.edu.ro/sites/default/files/ordin%20comun%20nr.%203.235_93_4.02.2021.pdf    https://archive.fo/85fHU

As of 15 February, the ban on indoor operation for bars, clubs, and disco activities remains in place.    Cinemas, performance institutions, indoor restaurants, indoor cafés, and gambling halls are allowed to operate under the following conditions:    Without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and only in the time interval 6.00-23.00, in the counties/localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5/1,000 inhabitants.    Without exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space and only in the time interval 6.00-23.00, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of the cases in the county/locality is higher than 1.5 and less than or equal to 3/1,000 inhabitants.    It is forbidden if the cumulative incidence of cases is higher than 3/1,000 inhabitants.    Currently, the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is over 3 per 1,000 occupants in Timis and Maramures counties, therefore, cinemas, performance institutions, indoor restaurants, indoor cafés, and gambling halls are closed in these counties.     Museums, art galleries, libraries, and bookstores are open with social distancing and mask requirements. Disinfection of hands and a temperature check is required before entering.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211825/https://stirioficiale.ro/conduita    https://archive.fo/85fHU

The organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals or other cultural events is allowed in counties/localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5/1,000 inhabitants.     Events are limited to 300 spectators with seats located at a distance of at least 2 meters apart. Protective masks are also required.    Activities are prohibited in counties/localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is higher than 1.5/1,000 inhabitants.    Currently the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is higher than 1.5/1,000 occupants in Timis, Maramures, Cluj, Brasov, Ilfov, Bucharest, Alba, Hunedoara, Satu Mare, Sibiu, Salaj, and Gorj counties.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211825/https://stirioficiale.ro/conduita    https://archive.fo/85fHU

Throughout Romania, it is forbidden for people to be outside the home between 23.00 - 05.00, with the following exceptions:    Travel in the professional interest, including between home / household and the place / places where the professional activity takes place and back.    Travel for medical care that cannot be postponed or performed remotely, as well as for the purchase of medicines.    Travel outside the locality of persons who are in transit or make journeys whose time interval overlaps with the prohibition period such as those made by plane, train, coach or other means of passenger transport and which can be proved by ticket or any another way to pay for the trip.    Travel for justified reasons, such as caring for / accompanying the child, assisting the elderly, sick or disabled or the death of a family member.    In order to justify moving away from home during this period, citizens must have on them the declaration on their own responsibility, the certificate from the employer or the service card (the last two can only be used to justify moving for professional purposes).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211825/https://stirioficiale.ro/conduita

There are no restrictions on intercity travel with the exception of areas placed under localized quarantine.    Currently, a zonal quarantine is in place for Seini locality, Maramures county.  The quarantine was established on 10 February at 12.00 and will expire on 24 February at 12.00, for a total of 14 days.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220030928/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/237279    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220031103/https://www.mai.gov.ro/utile/

On 15 February, the updated list of high epidemiological risk states was implemented. The list now includes 67 states, compared to 65 on 4 February.    Upon entering Romania, travelers arriving from countries on this list are required to quarantine for 14 days. Those who submit a PCR test no later than 72 hours before entry must quarantine for 10 days.    "Upon entering Romania, for persons arriving from countries / areas / territories of high epidemiological risk and presents a document attesting the negative result of an RT-PCR test for SARS-CoV virus infection-2, made no later than 72 hours before boarding (for those traveling by public transport) or entering the national territory (for those traveling by own means), the quarantine measure is established at home or at the location declared for a period of 10 days."      Economic operators that carry out international, air and road transport of persons, by regular or irregular flights to Romania from high epidemiological risk areas have the obligation to prohibit the embarkation in the means of transport of persons who do not present a document certifying:    The negative result of an RT-PCR test for SARS-CoV-2 virus infection, performed no more than 72 hours before boarding, or    The vaccination against the SARS-CoV-2 virus, including the second dose, and for which at least 10 days have elapsed since its administration until the date of embarkation, or    That they have been confirmed positive for SARS-CoV-2 virus infection in the last 90 days prior to embarkation and that at least 14 days have elapsed from the date of confirmation to the date of embarkation. The proof of confirmation is made with medical documents such as: positive RT-PCR test at the date of diagnosis, hospital discharge ticket or test proving the presence of IgG antibodies performed up to 14 days before entering the country, as well as other documents supporting documents.      All travelers arriving in Romania who have been fully vaccinated from COVID-19 are exempt from quarantining on arrival.    The second dose must have been administered at least 10 days prior to their arrival.    "The vaccination proof, including the date when the second dose was administered, should be made through the document issued by the health unit that administered it, whether that be in Romania or abroad," the CNSU said in a statement.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210219224903/https://www.news.ro/social/update-cnsu-actualizat-lista-zonelor-risc-epidemiologic-ridicat-stabilit-regulile-aplicare-masurii-carantinei-asupra-persoanelor-sosesc-acestea-persoanele-prezinta-test-pcr-negativ-stau-carantina-10-1922404011002021022219971215    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219225551/https://i0.1616.ro/media/2/2701/33586/19971215/3/anexa-la-hotararea-cnsu-nr-9.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219232637/https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/countries-open-to-vaccinated-travelers/index.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220034758/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotararea-nr-9-din-11-02-2021-cnsu

On 1 January 2021, Emergency Ordinance No. 227 went into effect.    The bank's clients, individuals with ongoing loans, whose income was directly or indirectly affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, can benefit from the facility to suspend the payment of installments according to GEO 37/2020 as amended by GEO 227/2020 .    The total period of suspension of payment obligations for a loan is a maximum of 9 months and includes: the periods of suspension requested and granted until 15 June 2020 based on GEO 37/2020, the periods of suspension granted based on a private moratorium and the periods of suspension requested after the entry into force of GEO 227/2020.    Under these conditions, only clients who have not already benefited from the maximum deferral period for payment based on the public moratorium established by GEO 37/2020 and / or based on a private moratorium are eligible.       In order to benefit from the suspension of payments according to GEO 37/2020 as amended by GEO 227/2020, the following criteria must be met:    Individual’s income and / or family income has been affected by the situation generated by the COVID-19 pandemic compared to the level registered before the declaration of the state of emergency and is are unable to honor the payment obligations related to the credit.     15 March is the application deadline, inclusive.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220061111/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/235875    https://web.archive.org/web/20200507141027/https://www.raiffeisen.ro/persoane-fizice/in-sprijinul-tau/asistenta/suspendare-rate-credite/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220062628/https://www.unicredit.ro/ro/persoane-fizice/Diverse/covid-19.html

Moldova today received humanitarian assistance on behalf of Romania’s government, which will fill the emergency stocks with products, materials and sanitary equipment necessary to prevent the spread of the coronavirus infection. The official ceremony on the humanitarian assistance’s delivery took place on the Great National Assembly Square, where a column of 13 trucks with donated materials, worth 2.3 million euros, was placed, the government’s communication and protocol department has reported.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210220231049/https://www.moldpres.md/en/news/2021/02/19/21001307

As of 20 February, public transportation remains open.     Wearing of “protection masks” to cover the nose and mouth is mandatory in taxis, public transportation and public outdoor spaces such as bus stops, metro stops, train stations and airports.    Taxi passengers may only sit in the back seats.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211825/https://stirioficiale.ro/conduita    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

On 4 December, the provisions of articles XI and XV of the Government Emergency Ordinance No. 30/2020 for establishing measures in the field of social protection in the context of the epidemiological situation determined by the spread of SARS-CoV-2 was extended until 30 June 2021.    Article XI states that as a result of the effects produced by the SARS-CoV-2, the allowances that benefit employees are set at 75% of the basic salary corresponding to the job occupied and are borne from the unemployment insurance budget, but not more than 75% of the average gross earnings provided.     Article XV states that other professionals, as well as persons who have concluded individual labor agreements which are interrupted as a result of the effects of the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 during the state of emergency, benefits from the state budget, based on the declaration on its own responsibility, a monthly allowance of 75% of the average gross earnings provided by law on the state social insurance budget.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201125000054/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocumentAfis/225659    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220043552/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocumentAfis/234289

As of 20 February, the official government website for COVID-19 remains current. (https://stirioficiale.ro/informatii). Daily updates, press releases, current restrictions, statistics, educational videos, hygiene recommendations, advice for parents, and answers to frequently asked questions are provided on the website.     Individuals can also subscribe to an official email newsletter for updates and important information.     Chrome and Firefox web browser extensions have been created by the Code for Romania Task Force. The purpose of the extensions are to highlight official sources of information in order to reduce the effects of 'fake news'. The extension identifies key phrases related to COVID-19 and adds an info box that links to official sources    RoVaccinare is the official platform for information regarding vaccination against COVID-19 in Romania (vaccinare-covid.gov.ro). The website provides news, information on authorized vaccines, the vaccination process in Romania, and corrects misinformation surrounding vaccines.     A helpline has been established for individuals with symptoms and for those with questions about the transmission and spread of the virus (0800 800 358).    Additional information is also provided on the Ministry of Health’s website (www.ms.ro/coronavirus-covid-19).     https://web.archive.org/web/20210220205733/https://stirioficiale.ro/informatii    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220211201/https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/covid-19-stiri-oficiale/pdcpkplohipjhdfdchpmgekifmcdbnha    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219140826/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118094602/https://cetrebuiesafac.ro/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220231150/https://stirioficiale.ro/informatii/buletin-de-presa-19-februarie-2021-ora-13-00

As of 20 February, individuals with symptoms should call a family doctor who will make a telephone assessment and decide the way forward. If the doctor decides that a COVID-19 test is needed, the individual will be instructed to call the Public Health Directorate and mention all symptoms.    The ambulance service will go to the individual’s house to perform the test, or if the situation requires it, will transport the individual to the hospital.    In the case of symptomatic people, the test is done according to the protocol, free of charge.    Individuals can also get tested "on request", but this option is for a fee.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118094602/https://cetrebuiesafac.ro/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The Government of Romania has defined “close contact” with COVID-19 infected individuals to facilitate epidemiological investigations.    The purpose of defining close contact to identify individuals designated for 14-day self-isolation following close contact with a COVID-19 confirmed infection.    During the period of self-isolation, “close contact” individuals will be tested at the beginning and end of the two-week period. The epidemiological investigation should not lead to the supervised isolation of other individuals not meeting “close contact” criteria.    This includes:  Persons living in the same household as a confirmed COVID-19 patient.    Persons with direct physical contact with confirmed patients.    Persons with unprotected direct contact (i.e. coughing)    Persons in the same room (i.e. students) with a confirmed patient for a minimum of 15 minutes at a distance less than 2 meters.    Medical personnel providing direct care to confirmed patients without proper protective equipment.      On 11 February, a teacher from Salaj County was confirmed with COVID-19, this being the first case of infection since the resumption of face-to-face courses. Students will go to school online for 14 days.    The representatives of the Salaj Public Health Directorate started the epidemiological investigation, in order to establish direct contacts of the teacher, and will decide together with the management of the educational unit if quarantine is required.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220215742/https://adevarul.ro/locale/zalau/primul-cadru-didactic-infectat-reluarea-cursurilor-autoritatile-demarat-ancheta-epidemiologica-1_60251ec05163ec4271dedab2/index.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220215946/http://www.ms.ro/2020/10/28/se-modifica-fluxul-informational-utilizat-in-raportarea-datelor-referitoare-la-infectia-cu-virusul-sars-cov-2/

As of 20 February, stage 2 of the vaccination campaign against COVID is ongoing. Vaccines are provided at no cost to the individual.     Between 18 February at 17:00 and 19 February at 17:00, 28,019 Pfizer vaccines, 671 Moderna vaccines, and 9,438 AstraZeneca vaccines were administered.    Stage 2 includes adults over the age of 65; persons with chronic diseases, regardless of age, according to the indications of the vaccines used; persons with a degree of disability, immobilized persons, immunocompromised persons, their companions and persons living in the same household with them; homeless people; essential workers.    On 20 February, the coordinator of the vaccination campaign against COVID, military doctor Valeriu Gheorghita, said that stage 3 of the vaccination campaign could start in April, and registration would start in March.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222235341/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/actualizare-zilnica-19-02-evidenta-persoanelor-vaccinate-impotriva-covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222235113/https://www.digi24.ro/stiri/actualitate/sanatate/valeriu-gheorghita-a-anuntat-cand-va-incepe-vaccinarea-persoanelor-din-etapa-a-iii-a-1455320?__grsc=cookieIsUndef0&__grts=53801262&__grua=915fe5f49a696a6a12f1f7d93c029921&__grrn=1    https://web.archive.org/web/20210201234335/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/vaccinarea-sars-cov-2/procesul-de-vaccinare-in-romania/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223000515/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/resurse/intrebari-si-raspunsuri/

According to the ministerial order no.3.235/93/04.02.2021, depending on the incidence rate by localities, the activity of the educational units will be organized, starting with 8th of February, in three scenarios: a) Physical presence for all categories, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days in the locality is less or equal to 1/1000 people; b) physical presence for preschool, primary, 8th, 12th and 13th classes, and online presence for the other classes, for a incidence less or equal with 3/1000; c) Online presence for all categories, except preschool and primary units, if incidence is higher than 3/1000.    Links: https://archive.fo/wip/H8lox

The Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through the Decision 35/10.02.2021) of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance).   Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp,  https://archive.fo/T7Aib, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf  and https://archive.fo/4mnCH

According to the Decision 35/10.02.2021, the alert status on the Romanian territory is extended. It is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Additionally, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: Link: https://archive.fo/4mnCH and https://archive.fo/wip/a09tG

There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions) The National Institute of Public Health published a new list of states with high epidemiological risk. The decisions no.6/04.02.2021 and 9/11.02.2021 of National Committee for Emergency Situations contain the required conditions for the passengers coming in Romania from countries with high epidemiological risk.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210226145023/http://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/liste-zone-afectate-covid-19, https://web.archive.org/web/20210228162247/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotararea-nr-9-din-11-02-2021-cnsu and https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.  On 30th of December, the Government released Emergency Ordinance no. 224, which includes the support measures to ensure the continuity of the activity of economic operators in the tourism sector, accommodation structures, food structures and travel agencies. These can receive grants, in the amount of 20% from the loss of turnover or turnover in 2020 comparing with 2019 (up to 800 000 euro/enterprise).  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/wip/2xyN6

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released.  Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/O0MTX#selection-697.0-697.76

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/4mnCH

Second stage of the vaccination campaign started on 15th of January and is aimed at people over 65 aged, people with chronic diseases (regardless of age) and key staff working in key areas. The coordinator of the National Committee for the Planning of COVID-19 Vaccination in Romania, announced how the appointments of people over 65 years of age and those with chronic diseases can be made. (Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines are used).  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/IzHsa and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

According to the Decision 35/10.02.2021, the alert status on the Romanian territory is extended. It is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, on 15th of January, the second stage of the vaccination campaign started, aiming people over 65 age and people with chronic diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/4mnCH and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

According to the ministerial order no.3.235/93/04.02.2021, depending on the incidence rate by localities, the activity of the educational units will be organized, starting with 8th of February, in three scenarios: a) Physical presence for all categories, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days in the locality is less or equal to 1/1000 people; b) physical presence for preschool, primary, 8th, 12th and 13th classes, and online presence for the other classes, for a incidence less or equal with 3/1000; c) Online presence for all categories, except preschool and primary units, if incidence is higher than 3/1000.    Links: https://archive.fo/wip/H8lox

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, fairs, mixed, flying and flea markets will be forbidden. For the economic operators having activities in closed and/or open spaces, (public or private) to organize their activity only between 05:00 and 21:00. According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020, it is proposed to resume the activity of agri-food markets organized in closed spaces. Outdoor cafes and clubs are closed between 11 PM and 6 AM.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://archive.fo/wip/cz2hH

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, the meetings on public holidays, public and/or private parties in closed and/or open spaces are prohibited.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, the meetings on public holidays, anniversaries, public and/or private parties in closed and/or open spaces are prohibited.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours. If the threshold of 6/1000 is exceeded, the quarantine will be applied immediately, and all activities will be online.    Links: https://archive.fo/wip/iP5sE

The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released.  Links: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://archive.fo/klswT , https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://archive.fo/O0MTX#selection-697.0-697.76

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/4mnCH

Second stage of the vaccination campaign started on 15th of January and is aimed at people over 65 aged, people with chronic diseases (regardless of age) and key staff working in key areas. The coordinator of the National Committee for the Planning of COVID-19 Vaccination in Romania, announced how the appointments of people over 65 years of age and those with chronic diseases can be made. (Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccines are used).  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/IzHsa, https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F and https://archive.fo/wip/eDFWM

According to the Decision 35/10.02.2021, the alert status on the Romanian territory is extended. It is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, on 15th of January, the second stage of the vaccination campaign started, aiming people over 65 age and people with chronic diseases.   Link: https://archive.fo/4mnCH and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

According to the ministerial order no.3.459/280/06.03.2021, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 3/1000 inhabitants, but lower than 6/1000, the participation in classes is with physical presence for all preschoolers and primary school students, students from grades 8th, 12th, and 13th classes. If the threshold of 6/1000 is exceeded, the quarantine will be applied immediately, and all activities will be online.    Links:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185439/https://www.edu.ro/modific%C4%83ri-ale-m%C4%83surilor-de-organizare-activit%C4%83%C5%A3ii-%C3%AEn-cadrul-unit%C4%83%C5%A3ilorinstitu%C5%A3iilor-de-%C3%AEnv%C4%83%C5%A3%C4%83m%C3%A2nt and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185940/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-15-din-05-03-2021

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, fairs, mixed, flying and flea markets will be forbidden. For the economic operators having activities in closed and/or open spaces, (public or private) to organize their activity only between 05:00 and 21:00. According to the Decision 56/4.12.2020, it is proposed to resume the activity of agri-food markets organized in closed spaces. Outdoor cafes and clubs are closed between 11 PM and 6 AM.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315190303/https://archive.fo/cz2hH

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, the meetings on public holidays, public and/or private parties in closed and/or open spaces are prohibited.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, the meetings on public holidays, anniversaries, public and/or private parties in closed and/or open spaces are prohibited.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

The Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through the Decision 35/10.02.2021) of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf, https://web.archive.org/web/20210315190546/https://archive.fo/4mnCH  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315190736/https://archive.fo/KFsdV

According to the Decision 35/10.02.2021, the alert status on the Romanian territory is extended. It is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Additionally, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315190546/https://archive.fo/4mnCH   and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315190736/https://archive.fo/KFsdV

There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions) The National Institute of Public Health published a new list of states with high epidemiological risk. The decisions no. 15/05.03.2021 of National Committee for Emergency Situations contains the required conditions for the passengers coming in Romania from countries with high epidemiological risk.   Link https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185940/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-15-din-05-03-2021 and https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184742/https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185046/https://archive.fo/hVM21

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.  On 30th of December, the Government released Emergency Ordinance no. 224, which includes the support measures to ensure the continuity of the activity of economic operators in the tourism sector, accommodation structures, food structures and travel agencies. These can receive grants, in the amount of 20% from the loss of turnover or turnover in 2020 comparing with 2019 (up to 800 000 euro/enterprise).  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185339/https://archive.fo/2xyN6

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and development of activity in cinemas, performance institutions and / or concerts are allowed with the participation of the public up to 50% of the maximum capacity of the space, if the incidence accumulated in the last 14 days of cases in the county / locality is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants. Also, the activity of restaurants and cafes inside hotels, boarding houses or other accommodation units is allowed without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and in the time interval 6.00-22.00, in the counties / localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants, not exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals, or other cultural events are allowed only with the participation of up to 300 spectators with seats, at a distance of at least 2 meters from each other, as well as wearing a protective mask. Activities are prohibited in counties / localities where the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, it is forbidden to organize private events (weddings, baptisms, festive meals, etc.) in open spaces, such as, but not limited to, salons, cultural centers, restaurants, terraces, bars, cafes, halls / tents. Additionally, recreational outdoor and sporting activities are prohibited, except for those carried out with the participation of no more than 10 persons not living together.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy0

On 15th of March, the third stage of the vaccination program for the general population began. Also, on 15th of March, the National Coordinating Committee for Vaccination Activities against COVID-19 decided to continue the vaccination campaign in Romania will all vaccines against COVID-19, following the analysis of the adverse reaction reports registered in Romania and the recommendations of the European Medicines Agency.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/  and  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322054356/https://stirioficiale.ro/informatii/precizari-privind-vaccinarea-cu-vaccinul-produs-de-compania-oxford-astrazeneca-15-03-2020

Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/ and https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy0

According to the ministerial order no.3.459/280/06.03.2021, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 3/1000 inhabitants, but lower than 6/1000, the participation in classes is with physical presence for all preschoolers and primary school students, students from grades 8th, 12th, and 13th classes. If the threshold of 6/1000 is exceeded, the quarantine will be applied immediately, and all activities will be online.    Links:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185439/https://www.edu.ro/modific%C4%83ri-ale-m%C4%83surilor-de-organizare-activit%C4%83%C5%A3ii-%C3%AEn-cadrul-unit%C4%83%C5%A3ilorinstitu%C5%A3iilor-de-%C3%AEnv%C4%83%C5%A3%C4%83m%C3%A2nt and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185940/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-15-din-05-03-2021

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and development of activity in cinemas, performance institutions and / or concerts are allowed with the participation of the public up to 50% of the maximum capacity of the space, if the incidence accumulated in the last 14 days of cases in the county / locality is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants. Also, the activity of restaurants and cafes inside hotels, boarding houses or other accommodation units is allowed without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and in the time interval 6.00-22.00, in the counties / localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants, not exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals, or other cultural events are allowed only with the participation of up to 300 spectators with seats, at a distance of at least 2 meters from each other, as well as wearing a protective mask. Activities are prohibited in counties / localities where the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, it is forbidden to organize private events (weddings, baptisms, festive meals, etc.) in open spaces, such as, but not limited to, salons, cultural centers, restaurants, terraces, bars, cafes, halls / tents. Additionally, recreational outdoor and sporting activities are prohibited, except for those carried out with the participation of no more than 10 persons not living together.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy0

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

E1 Income Support 2F     K  The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184742/https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185046/https://archive.fo/hVM21

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released.  Links: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193144/https://archive.fo/cUlEp , https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193218/https://archive.fo/klswT, https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193322/https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193430/https://archive.fo/O0MTX

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193619/https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193759/https://archive.fo/thRdi  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193827/https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.2021 of the Government of Romania (approved with additions by Law no.20/2020), in closed public spaces, commercial spaces, means of public transport and work, there is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask. According to the Decision no.16/10.03.21, a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 22:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance) is in place.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329175617/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-16-din-10-03-2021-a-cnsu

There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions) The National Institute of Public Health published a new list of states with high epidemiological risk. The decisions no. 15/05.03.2021 of National Committee for Emergency Situations contains the required conditions for the passengers coming in Romania from countries with high epidemiological risk.   Link https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185940/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-15-din-05-03-2021 and https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184742/https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185046/https://archive.fo/hVM21

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released.  Links: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193144/https://archive.fo/cUlEp , https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193218/https://archive.fo/klswT, https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193322/https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193430/https://archive.fo/O0MTX

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193619/https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193759/https://archive.fo/thRdi  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193827/https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.2021 of the Government of Romania (approved with additions by Law no.20/2020), in closed public spaces, commercial spaces, means of public transport and work, there is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy0

On 15th of March, the third stage of the vaccination program for the general population began. Also, on 15th of March, the National Coordinating Committee for Vaccination Activities against COVID-19 decided to continue the vaccination campaign in Romania will all vaccines against COVID-19, following the analysis of the adverse reaction reports registered in Romania and the recommendations of the European Medicines Agency.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/  and  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322054356/https://stirioficiale.ro/informatii/precizari-privind-vaccinarea-cu-vaccinul-produs-de-compania-oxford-astrazeneca-15-03-2020

Also, on 15th of March, the third stage of the vaccination program for the general population began.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/ and https://web.archive.org/web/20210329175617/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-16-din-10-03-2021-a-cnsu

According to the ministerial order no.3.459/280/06.03.2021, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 3/1000 inhabitants, but lower than 6/1000, the participation in classes is with physical presence for all preschoolers and primary school students, students from grades 8th, 12th, and 13th classes. If the threshold of 6/1000 is exceeded, the quarantine will be applied immediately, and all activities will be online.    Links:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185439/https://www.edu.ro/modific%C4%83ri-ale-m%C4%83surilor-de-organizare-activit%C4%83%C5%A3ii-%C3%AEn-cadrul-unit%C4%83%C5%A3ilorinstitu%C5%A3iilor-de-%C3%AEnv%C4%83%C5%A3%C4%83m%C3%A2nt and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185940/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-15-din-05-03-2021

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and development of activity in cinemas, performance institutions and / or concerts are allowed with the participation of the public up to 50% of the maximum capacity of the space, if the incidence accumulated in the last 14 days of cases in the county / locality is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants. Also, the activity of restaurants and cafes inside hotels, boarding houses or other accommodation units is allowed without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and in the time interval 6.00-22.00, in the counties / localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants, not exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals, or other cultural events are allowed only with the participation of up to 300 spectators with seats, at a distance of at least 2 meters from each other, as well as wearing a protective mask. Activities are prohibited in counties / localities where the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, it is forbidden to organize private events (weddings, baptisms, festive meals, etc.) in open spaces, such as, but not limited to, salons, cultural centers, restaurants, terraces, bars, cafes, halls / tents. Additionally, recreational outdoor and sporting activities are prohibited, except for those carried out with the participation of no more than 10 persons not living together.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy0

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

According to the ministerial order no.3.459/280/06.03.2021, if the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 3/1000 inhabitants, but lower than 6/1000, the participation in classes is with physical presence for all preschoolers and primary school students, students from grades 8th, 12th, and 13th classes. If the threshold of 6/1000 is exceeded, the quarantine will be applied immediately, and all activities will be online.    Links:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185439/https://www.edu.ro/modific%C4%83ri-ale-m%C4%83surilor-de-organizare-activit%C4%83%C5%A3ii-%C3%AEn-cadrul-unit%C4%83%C5%A3ilorinstitu%C5%A3iilor-de-%C3%AEnv%C4%83%C5%A3%C4%83m%C3%A2nt and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185940/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotarare-nr-15-din-05-03-2021

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, the organization and development of activity in cinemas, performance institutions and / or concerts are allowed with the participation of the public up to 50% of the maximum capacity of the space, if the incidence accumulated in the last 14 days of cases in the county / locality is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants. Also, the activity of restaurants and cafes inside hotels, boarding houses or other accommodation units is allowed without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and in the time interval 6.00-22.00, in the counties / localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants, not exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, the organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals, or other cultural events are allowed only with the participation of up to 300 spectators with seats, at a distance of at least 2 meters from each other, as well as wearing a protective mask. Activities are prohibited in counties / localities where the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, it is forbidden to organize private events (weddings, baptisms, festive meals, etc.) in open spaces, such as, but not limited to, salons, cultural centers, restaurants, terraces, bars, cafes, halls / tents. Additionally, recreational outdoor and sporting activities are prohibited, except for those carried out with the participation of no more than 10 persons not living together.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions) The National Institute of Public Health published a new list of states with high epidemiological risk. The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 include:   1.	The criteria for sending employees into technical unemployment and minimum income ensured for freelancers working in industries where activity is reduced or interrupted due to the pandemic.  2.	The conditions for granting free paid days to parents, to supervise their children during the temporary closure of educational establishments.  3.	The online submission of the documentation needed to gain access to social benefits.  4.	The measures for ensuring continuity in the granting of return to work incentives and childcare allowance, as well as for facilitating access to medical leave and medical leave indemnities for quarantined persons.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184742/https://archive.fo/FtT0q

On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185046/https://archive.fo/hVM21

According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.  On 30th of December, the Government released Emergency Ordinance no. 224, which includes the support measures to ensure the continuity of the activity of economic operators in the tourism sector, accommodation structures, food structures and travel agencies. These can receive grants, in the amount of 20% from the loss of turnover or turnover in 2020 comparing with 2019 (up to 800 000 euro/enterprise).  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185339/https://archive.fo/2xyN6

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released. An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193759/https://archive.fo/thRdi  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193827/https://archive.fo/FUhtr
