Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185046/https://archive.fo/hVM21

Ministry of Health published “Recommendations on responsible social behavior in preventing the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)” and “Recommended measures to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic”. On 29th of October, The Government of Romania announced the List of infection diseases for which the isolation of persons is established at their home. The same document establishes the basic health units in which sick people can be treated with diseases provided in the list of infectious diseases. Also, the National Information Platform on vaccination against COVID-19 was released.  Links: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193144/https://archive.fo/cUlEp , https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193218/https://archive.fo/klswT, https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193322/https://archive.fo/Vi0vG and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193430/https://archive.fo/O0MTX

According to the Ministry of Health, the units that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to perform the diagnosis by RT-PCR have the obligation to provide priority diagnosis for patients in health facilities, suspects in epidemiological investigations, and people at risk, according to the methodology of the National Institute of Public Health – National Center for Surveillance and Control of Communicable Diseases.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193619/https://archive.fo/6K5UM

An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193759/https://archive.fo/thRdi  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315193827/https://archive.fo/FUhtr

According to the Decision no.293/10.03.2021 of the Government of Romania (approved with additions by Law no.20/2020), in closed public spaces, commercial spaces, means of public transport and work, there is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy0

On 15th of March, the third stage of the vaccination program for the general population began.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 22:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance) is in place. Also, on 15th of March, the third stage of the vaccination program for the general population began.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/ and https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

On 5th of May, The Government of Romania granted the Republic of Moldova, free of charge, 100 800 doses of AstraZeneca vaccine. The doses were purchased by the Romanian Ministry of Health and delivered by the company AstraZeneca.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210509165609/https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Open+Sans:400,700&subset=latin-ext and https://web.archive.org/web/20210509063307/https://www.digi24.ro/stiri/actualitate/un-nou-ajutor-pentru-republica-moldova-romania-trimite-peste-100-000-doze-de-vaccin-impotriva-covid-19-1518729?__grsc=cookieIsUndef0&__grts=54018066&__grua=0f80c204689047c819c4f589cee7a7eb&__grrn=1

According to the ministerial order no.3755/29.04.2021 (which extends order no. 3235/93/2021), if the cumulative incidence of cases, in a locality for the last 14 days, is lower than 1/1000 inhabitants, the participation in classes will be physical presence for all preschoolers, primary school students and other groups of students. If it is higher than 1/1000, all activities will be online, except the students from grades 8th, 12th, and 13th classes.    Links: https://web.archive.org/web/20210509164637/https://www.edu.ro/sites/default/files/_fi%C8%99iere/Legislatie/2021/Ordin%20comun%20ME_MS_3755_2021.pdf

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, the organization and development of activity in cinemas, performance institutions and / or concerts are allowed with the participation of the public up to 50% of the maximum capacity of the space, if the incidence accumulated in the last 14 days of cases in the county / locality is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants. Also, the activity of restaurants and cafes inside hotels, boarding houses or other accommodation units is allowed without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and in the time interval 6.00-22.00, in the counties / localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants, not exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, the organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals, or other cultural events are allowed only with the participation of up to 300 spectators with seats, at a distance of at least 2 meters from each other, as well as wearing a protective mask. Activities are prohibited in counties / localities where the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

According to the Decision no.432/8.04.21, it is forbidden to organize private events (weddings, baptisms, festive meals, etc.) in open spaces, such as, but not limited to, salons, cultural centers, restaurants, terraces, bars, cafes, halls / tents. Additionally, recreational outdoor and sporting activities are prohibited, except for those carried out with the participation of no more than 10 persons not living together.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210418150432/http://legislatie.just.ro/Public/DetaliiDocument/240862

According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours. There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions). Travelers with a point of departure in a high-risk country must present a negative PT-PCR test for SARS-CoV-2, performed no more than 72 hours before boarding a flight and no more than 72 hours before entry in Romania for people arriving by car. The National Institute of Public Health published a new list of states with high epidemiological risk. The decisions no. 432/8.04.2021 of National Committee for Emergency Situations contains the required conditions for the passengers coming in Romania from countries with high epidemiological risk. Authorities in Romania have eased several domestic COVID-19-related restrictions on June 1 following a significant decrease in infection rates. Among unvaccinated residents, groups of up to eight persons may gather outdoors, overall, Outdoor gatherings are limited to 1,000 persons. Limitations on attendance at indoor gatherings including concerts, weddings and other cultural, leisure, or religious activities, have been lifted provided all the attendees are vaccinated. Gyms, fitness centres, museums, public swimming pools, and restaurants may operate at 70 per cent capacity.   Private events (weddings, baptisms, and birthdays) may accommodate a maximum of 70 guests outdoor, 50 guests indoor, or unlimited guests if those attending are all vaccinated.     https://archive.vn/qnADk   https://archive.vn/vztLy

International Entry RestrictionsUnder most circumstances, only travellers from European Economic Area (EEA) and EU countries are permitted to enter Romania. Exceptions are in place for family members of EEA citizens and residents, individuals travelling for essential work or study, individuals in transit, and individuals travelling for urgent reasons. Authorities keep and regularly update a list of "high-risk" countries. The list of high-risk countries includes Estonia, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Cyprus, Sweden, France, Italy, Austria, Belgium, Turkey, and the Netherlands, among others.    Permitted individuals arriving from countries not included on the list of high-risk areas can enter without restriction. Individuals arriving from high-risk countries must provide a negative result from a COVID-19 test taken within the previous 72 hours and self-isolate for 14 days on arrival; this can be reduced to 10 days by testing negative for COVID-19 on day eight of self-isolation. Cross-border workers, transport workers, and individuals in transit remaining in Romania for less than 24 hours are exempt from the quarantine requirements. Individuals who can present proof they have received a full course of vaccination against COVID-19 no less than 10 days ago or have been confirmed positive for COVID-19 and recovered in the previous 90 days are also exempt from the quarantine requirements.    https://archive.vn/vztLy

Due to the recent decrease in COVID-19 cases, the Government of Romania announced new relaxation measures.  The new restrictions generally increase capacity and participant limits for public and private events, restaurants and resorts, and other entertainment activities.  In general, events and venues may accommodate clients at full capacity if all participants are vaccinated.  Otherwise, the measures reflect a gradual relaxation of restrictions. They include the following:  Private events (weddings, baptisms, and birthdays) may accommodate a maximum of 70 guests outdoor, 50 guests indoor, or unlimited guests if those attending are all vaccinated.  Restaurants and cafés may open between 0500-2400 at 70% capacity or full capacity if all guests are vaccinated.  Gyms and fitness facilities may open at 70% capacity with seven meters distance between clients or full capacity if all clients are vaccinated.  In certain localities with low incident rates, masks may not be required.    https://archive.vn/pDiVM

International Entry RestrictionsAuthorities designate countries as Green, Yellow, or Red depending on local infection rates and the presence of virus variants. Travellers from Green countries may enter Romania without restriction. Travellers from Yellow and Red countries must self-isolate for 14 days on arrival, though they can end self-isolation after 10 days following a negative COVID-19 test taken on day eight of isolation. Travellers from Yellow countries are exempt from the self-isolation requirement if they can present proof of a negative COVID-19 PCR test conducted no more than 72 hours before entering Romania. Additionally, travellers who have completed a full course of vaccination against COVID-19 at least 10 days before arrival in Romania, or who have recovered from COVID-19 14-180 days before arriving in the country are exempt from the quarantine requirement. Additional quarantine exemptions are in place for cross-border workers, transport workers, individuals in transit, and certain categories of essential work.    https://archive.vn/djnxh   https://archive.vn/RZaYk
